title: How are we supposed to practice champions?
body:
Normals is the worst game mode ever because no matter what you do, there will always be some idiot who doesn't respect call order and will just lock in whichever role they wanted.

I understand this is what team builder is for but honestly the queues are just wayyy too long. 

I just wanna improve some {{champion:7}}  man :'(

replies.body: become that idiot. Why do you think there are people like that? they were like you but getting bullied in champ select so they decide fuk it, im playing what i want, not litk here are any ramifications for poor behaviour in LoL yet.
Practice in bot games. That way, even if there is already a mage, you can try her out in another lane.

Ranked is best to practice since you vs your own skill level.

Leblanc = QRWE = Dead.

Lb is pretty easy tbh.

Your Q is a damage booster, so always begin combos with Q.

Your W is very good early game, but as time goes on, i'd start using it as a mobility skill.

E is your CC.

R is mana free, feel free to use it.

Practice the champion you want wherever you get, mid, support, kill lane bot, top, or double top/no jungle. 
Breaking the meta is fine in normals, just remain positive about it!

When in champion select, select Le Blanc don't lock, and say "Really want to play Le Blanc and willing to play anywhere, pref mid".
The rest is up to your team :).

Just do normals. You won't always get the position you want, so practice other champions too.
Or just go LeBlanc top.
do bots, or find a custom game lobby.
Perhaps go and play against bots and practice combos (this will get boring) or 1v1 friends for fun and practices.
